inscription: 十八公栄霜後露　一千年色雪中深 {jūhachi kō sakae shimo nochini tsuyu to naru / issennen no iro setchū ni fukashi} (When pine leaves turn into green, frost on them finally change into dew. One thousand-year lasting color had to be under snow deeply.(I guess!))
life_date: Utagawa Hiroshige, Japanese, 1797 – 1858; Wakasaya Yoichi, Publisher, Japanese
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: Untitled series of pictures of flowers and birds with poems in ōtanzaku
title: Macaw on Pine Branch
